DataElement.preferredName: Additional Hormone Therapy Post Recurrent Disease Administered Agent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of the additional hormonal agent administered to an individual after disease recurrence or progression. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Hormone Therapy Post Recurrent Disease Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the additional administration of  various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level after the return of a disease after a period of remission or new disease.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level. The treatment may include administration of hormones or hormone analogs to the patient, or decreasing the level of hormones in the body by using hormone antagonists, or hormone ablation therapy. The concept covers but not limited to: intermittent or permanent hormone suppression or ablation in treatment of hormone-dependent tumors, hormone replacement therapy of any kind, hormonal component of gender reassignment therapy, hormonal contraception, surgical and radiation castration.

Concepts.definition: Various treatment modalities that produce the desired therapeutic effect by means of change of hormone/hormones level.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
